data.title: Spring training
data.text: Excellent facility with good seating and pricing. It is easy to get to. It also has a good variety of food.

data.title: AZ Fall League and Spring Training Baseball
data.text: Very nice facility for baseball viewing.  Plenty of easy entry parking lots.  Hotels nearby.  Have been here on several occasions, always clean and inviting.  Concessions are well stocked with good service.

data.title: Spring Training Site
data.text: Have been to many spring training games here including the very first game played here.  Very nice stadium with good seats and a variety of foods/beverages.

data.title: A GREAT BASEBALL EXPERIENCE WITHOUT THE NEGATIVES ASSOCIATED WITH BIG CITY STADIUMS
data.text: Located 25-miles northwest of downtown Phoenix, Surprise Stadium on North Bullard offers a first class Spring Training experience (Kansas City Royals and Texas Rangers) with great seats, great views and modest prices. The 14-year old stadium owned by the City of Surprise accommodates up to 10,000 fans with seats in the sun and in the shade. No bad seats.

data.title: Leaves much to be desired
data.text: Leaves much to be desired as food is very mediocre . Was barely warm and taste wise it was very bland

data.title: Fall Ball
data.text: First time to AZ and fall league baseball. Stadium has plenty of free parking. Everyone was helpful and friendly. Seating for fall ball is general admission. I selected the shade since this game was at 12:30. Stadium is clean. The field is kept in good condition. I liked the signs along the concourse with baseball quotes. It would be a good place for a family day out. Tickets are reasonably priced unless you know a player and then they are free.

data.title: Excellent, intimate park.
data.text: This is a great place to see a spring training game or FallBall game.  No bad site lines and lots of shade along the first base side.  They could do a better job with food choices and food pricier though.

data.title: great little ball park
data.text: Great ball park in the city of Surprise, Went to watch Spring training games also some fall league games very comfortable set up. Loads of Vendors and Concessions. Can get quite hot and there isn't too much shade so bring a hat :)

data.title: baseball spring training site
data.text: Need more shade for this site. Good views from most seats. easy access to bathrooms and concessions.

data.title: Great time at the ballpark
data.text: We went to the stadium with family to see preseason Royals game.  Lots of fun, food very good and lots of vendors with nice merchandise.  Easy to get to and if you want to eat before game, lots of nearby restaurants.

data.title: Great Family Experience!!
data.text: We went to Spring training baseball, my cousin and his wife came from Texas to watch the Rangers play and we had a great time, while the teams were warming up they would hit balls into the outfield and once in a while they would toss a ball up to a kid standing there just waiting for a foul ball, the smiles on their faces was priceless, the little boys all bring their own mitts in hopes that they will catch a wayward ball. Great family event with lawn seating so the kids don't have to sit al the time, they can move around and hang over the fence in hopes of getting a ball.  Fun times

data.title: Our favorite little ballpark.
data.text: We have been to all the spring training ballparks, and several major league Arizona ballparks.  We love this one.  Food could be better. They used to serve Big City Red hotdogs that were awesome. Now the dogs are good, but not as great. More shade than most ballparks in Arizona.

data.title: baseball
data.text: spring training is our favorite time of year people come from all over different parts of the country and for only one thing to enjoy baseball at its finest

data.title: A Great Spring Training Venue
data.text: Surprise Stadium is the Spring Training home of the 2015 World Champions Kansas City Royals and the AL West Division Champs, The Texas Rangers. During the month of March and sometimes late February, there is a game everyday. The Stadium seats over 10,000 fans including on the grass beyond the outfield fences. Most importantly, there are a large number of seats under roof which is a great place to avoid the Arizona sun. Another great location is the second level which runs from the home plate down each base line.  The usual concessions, fan stores, beer and margaritas are also sold.  Finally, Surprise Stadium offer FREE parking a benefit not present at some other venues.  All in all it's a great place to spend a spring afternoon.

data.title: Kansas City Baseball Game!
data.text: This stadium is awesome! The home of the Kansas City Royals during Spring Training, which is held every March! Whether you are visiting our beautiful state of AZ or live here, take the time to see a game. Tickets are reasonable but also you can buy lawn space which is good with bigger families. With the Beautifully manicured grounds, your favorite team playing, hot dogs and peanuts, this will surely be a great experience unless it's a night game, the sunsets are what Arizona is all about.  Great place to come with your family and friends.

data.title: great staidum
data.text: This is a newer and well laid out stadium. Many of the seats are in the shade during spring training which is a plus.  Also they offer a good variety of food options although you will pay typical stadium prices.  Another plus is the parking is free and close to the ball park. One of our favorite stadiums to visit in the area.

data.title: Great Stadium
data.text: Went there for some high school baseball games , they were from all around the country, and most of the players stay at our hotel next door at the Resience Inn !

data.title: Beautiful stadium
data.text:
The Surprise Stadium has a beautiful field! It is very well laid out, lots of room to walk around and not a bad seat no matter where you sit.
The food however, is not worth writing about. Hot dogs are gross and they do not have a big menu selection at all. You are better off bringing in your unopened water and a sandwich.
To sum it up......great stadium, just don't go hungry 😉

data.title: A great afternoon at the park.
data.text: We sat in the shade a watched a game.  The weather was perfect.  Good cold beer and ballpark food available.

data.title: Best Spring Training Baseball Stadium in the Valley of the sun
data.text: Watched 12 spring training game in this beautiful friendly stadium. The ushers (called Sundancers) are volunteers for the City of Surprise. They really make the stadium and the ball games al lot of un.
